data.title: Marius | movelimitless.be
data.snippet:
movelimitless.be

# Marius

Marius Kwayep is business manager of Move Limitless. He is one of the best coaches in Mechelen with a lot of experience and proven competencies.

Marius is a certified sports coach with more than 7 years of experience as a personal trainer at professional sports centers. He holds an EREPS 4 certification and earned his degree from the well-known National Academy of Sports Medicine (NASM). In addition, Marius took additional courses around sports performance and is working as an instructor at Les Mills.

## How it began for Marius [...] ## How it began for Marius

" When I became a father years ago, my views on healthy living and what constitutes a healthy work-life balance changed. Out of my passion for fitness, I founded Move Limitless. I haven't regretted it for a day, even though entrepreneurship involves a lot that you're not prepared for."

## Marius' areas of expertise

At Move Limitless, Marius teaches private sessions, duo training, bootcamps and group training. He also specializes in coaching high-level sports players, including well-known soccer and basketball players. During functional training, Marius tackles several points at once, such as mobility, agility, strength,...

data.title: Marius Normore, NDP for Labrador | 2025 Canadian election
data.snippet:
They may still in the future!

## Biography

Marius Normore is proud to announce his candidacy for the New Democratic Party in the federal riding of Labrador.

Marius grew up in L‚ÄôAnse Au Loup and understands the challenges and opportunities facing the people of Labrador. A new father, Marius is deeply committed to a brighter future.

Marius holds a Bachelor of Science degree from Memorial University, a Safety Engineering Technology diploma from the College of the North Atlantic and is completing a Business Administration Certificate.

Marius has worked in diverse industries, including academia, research, and the Labrador mining sector along with eight years in workplace health and safety where he fosters collaboration and finds practical solutions for complex problems. [...] He is a passionate advocate for workplace safety, environmental responsibility, and the well-being of all Newfoundlanders and Labradorians.

Marius is running to amplify the voices of everyday people and to fight for fairness, opportunity, and sustainability in Newfoundland and Labrador. His experience, values, and dedication make him a strong representative for the New Democratic Party.

# Marius Kasnauskas

Marius Kasnauskas graduated Baymard‚Äôs 75-hour ‚ÄòTier 2: UX Professional‚Äô degree in 2023, testifying deep knowledge of Baymard‚Äôs UX research findings. [...] The ‚ÄòTier 2: UX Professional‚Äô degree is Baymard‚Äôs mid-level UX training program, covering 60% of the core findings from Baymard‚Äôs large-scale research. The degree provides the broad UX knowledge required to identify the most impactful UX issues on a given website and to build user experiences that will perform great with end users.

## Exams Passed (7)

This is not a ‚Äúget a certificate for showing up‚Äù training program ‚Äî trainees must pass 6 challenging UX exams to acquire certification, each of which require significant study of Baymard‚Äôs UX research findings.

### Cart & Checkout: UX Professional [...] ### Homepage & Category: UX Practitioner

Foundational knowledge of how users perceive your homepage, interpret category taxonomies, interact with the main navigation, and rely on intermediary category pages ‚Äî all with the intent of arriving at the list of products that matches what they are looking for.

## Certification

data.title: Marius von Hagen
data.snippet:
Outside his role as the acting CEO of Pax, Marius is a skilled painter. He graduated with honors from the Florence College of Art, a time he describes as special and extremely happy,, and he has returned to Stellis for post-graduate studies in art and art history in addition to his duties at Pax. He credits Van Kerrel with beginning his interest in art, having attended an auction he ran at age five.

To distinguish Marius from his brother, directors and veteran Pax employees refer to him as "Mr. Marius," while outsiders tend to buy into his rich brat persona and call him "Master Marius" or, more respectfully, "Mr. von Hagen."

### Childhood[edit | edit source] [...] It is difficult to understand this second young master. The inconvenient demands Marius must deal with every day are unimaginable. The public and secret battles against the top executives of the family conglomerate is not for the faint hearted. Moreover, he dislikes hypocritical social rules and refuses to give face to those who flatter and fawn. Perhaps instead of inheriting the family business, he would rather be free and unconstrained in creating art. Marius has completed an undergraduate course majoring in oil painting at the reputable Florence College of Art and is presently studying in the art department of Stellis University. One may think this kind of young master is ignorant and incompetent, but Marius' paintings are absolutely amazing. If one has the chance, it is highly [...] Marius attended Starhigh High School, Stellis' most prestigious private school, but he only stayed for a year. His status as a von Hagen made him the target of significant unwanted attention, and when false rumors of a feud between him and his brother made the situation worse and affected Giann's recent position at Pax, Marius left the country at age 16 to attend high school abroad instead to protect his family, claiming it would help him get used to foreign cultures before his enrollment at the Florence College of Art. The move required him to start over since his previous credits weren't accepted, but he attained all necessary credits to graduate in only two years.

## Personality and Interests[edit | edit source]

data.title: Gaius Marius | Roman General & Consul | Britannica
data.snippet:
Gaius Marius was a strong and brave soldier and a skillful general, popular with his troops, but he showed little flair for politics and was not a good public speaker. As an equestrian, he lacked the education in Greek normal to the upper classes. He was superstitious and overwhelmingly ambitious, and, because he failed to force the aristocracy to accept him, despite his great military success, he suffered from an inferiority complex that may help explain his jealousy and vindictive cruelty. As a young officer-cadet, along with Jugurtha (later king of Numidia), on Scipio Aemilianus‚Äô staff in the Numantine War in Spain (134 bce), he, like Jugurtha, made an excellent impression on his commanding officer. Marius‚Äô family enjoyed the patronage of more than one noble family, in particular the [...] Fact-checked by
